title: NIO Inc. (NIO): A Bull Case Theory
text: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on NIO Inc., an electric vehicle company operating in China, Europe, and internationally. The thesis highlights NIO's multi-brand strategy, strong delivery growth in Q3 and October 2025, improved financial performance with rising revenue and gross margins, and strategic expansion plans for profitability. The company's unique battery swap network and technology leadership are also noted as key strengths despite intense market competition.

title: Tesla introduces new Model Y variant in US priced at $41,990
text: Tesla has launched a new all-wheel-drive variant of its Model Y SUV in the U.S., priced at $41,990. This introduction follows Tesla's previous efforts in October to offer cheaper versions of the Model Y and Model 3 to maintain sales volumes after federal EV tax credits ended. CEO Elon Musk also recently announced that the company would cease production of its Model S and Model X sedans to reallocate manufacturing space for humanoid robots.

title: Tesla introduces new Model Y variant in US priced at $41,990
text: Tesla has launched a new all-wheel drive variant of its Model Y SUV in the U.S. for $41,990. This introduction comes as EV demand has softened and competition has increased, with Tesla having previously released cheaper versions of the Model Y and Model 3. CEO Elon Musk also recently announced that production of the Model S and X sedans would end to make space for humanoid robot manufacturing.

title: The Bull Case For Bio-Techne (TECH) Could Change Following New Synthetic Organoid ECM And Neuro Biomarker Tools
text: Bio-Techne has launched new Cultrex Synthetic Hydrogel for 3D stem cell and organoid research and ultra-sensitive Simple Plex assays for neurodegenerative biomarker detection. While these innovations reinforce Bio-Techne's position in high-value research areas, they may not immediately alter the company's near-term outlook of modest revenue growth and compressed profit margins. The article suggests that execution on these product launches will be crucial for influencing investor perception, especially given the company's current valuation.

title: Alphabet GOOG stock closes higher after-hours as Waymo lands $16B round and earnings loom
text: Alphabet's (GOOG) Class C shares rose 1.9% after Waymo, its self-driving car unit, announced a $16 billion funding round valuing it at $126 billion. This news comes just before Alphabet's earnings report, where investors will be looking for how new AI features will impact revenue and costs. Analysts like Jefferies have raised price targets for Alphabet, but the stock remains sensitive to future advertising or cloud outlooks and autonomous driving developments.

title: SpaceX bails out xAI in mega-deal — here’s what it means for Tesla
text: SpaceX has acquired Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, in a mega-deal reportedly valued at $1.25 trillion, creating a combined entity ahead of a planned IPO. This acquisition notably excludes Tesla, despite its recent $2 billion investment in xAI, which now translates to an indirect stake in the new combined company. The deal raises significant concerns for Tesla shareholders regarding Musk's priorities, the flow of cash, and potential conflicts of interest, as it appears to be a bailout for xAI.

title: 3 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now as Small Caps Heat Up
text: This article from Morningstar's "The Morning Filter" podcast discusses cheap stocks to buy as small caps heat up, analyzes recent tech earnings from Microsoft, Meta, Apple, and Tesla, and provides insights on other companies like Alphabet, Amazon, Pepsi, Mondelez, and Clorox. The hosts also address listener questions about Adobe and Amphenol, and conclude with three undervalued small-cap stock picks: Sensata Technologies (ST), Terex (TEX), and Mosaic (MOS).

title: Nvidia and Uber Just Announced a Major New Robotaxi Partnership. Does That Make UBER Stock a Buy Here?
text: Uber (UBER) has partnered with Nvidia (NVDA) and Mercedes (MBGYY) to develop a robotaxi company, leveraging Uber's vast real-life data for AI models. Despite recent Q3 earnings showing strong growth, the stock reacted negatively due to management's announcement that autonomous vehicles will not be profitable for several years. Analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for UBER, projecting significant upside, as future earnings growth and the company's valuable data are expected to drive its stock price higher.

title: Ballard Power Systems Is Exploding In Hype – But Is BLDP Stock A Total Steal Or Just Hot Air?
text: Ballard Power Systems (BLDP) is experiencing a surge in public attention due to the renewed interest in hydrogen fuel cells, particularly on social media. Despite the hype surrounding its potential in heavy-duty transportation decarbonization, the stock's price has declined significantly from past peaks, indicating market skepticism and classifying it as a high-risk, long-horizon speculative investment. The article advises potential investors to consider the company's financial state, competition, and their own risk tolerance before investing.

title: Tesla new car sales in Italy jump year-on-year in January, after 2025 drop
text: Tesla's new car registrations in Italy saw a significant 75% year-on-year increase in January, following an 18% drop throughout 2025. Despite the monthly volatility due to relatively low sales numbers in Italy, the company sold 713 cars last month, achieving a 0.5% market share. In 2025, Tesla sold 12,847 units in Italy, down from 15,650 in 2024.

title: Ford urges 'Made in Europe' to include Türkiye as carmakers wary | Daily Sabah
text: Ford of Europe President Jim Baumbick has called on the EU to ensure its "Made in Europe" industrial policy includes partners like Türkiye and the U.K., warning that their exclusion would weaken production within the bloc. This comes as the European Commission prepares to propose an Industrial Accelerator Act to strengthen European industry against cheaper imports. Carmakers, with their extensive global supply chains, are particularly concerned about the precise definition and potential narrowness of the "Made in Europe" initiative, which has divided EU member states.

title: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) Investors Press Executives on the Outlook Despite the Bookings Success
text: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) reported record fourth-quarter bookings of €13.2 billion, significantly exceeding analyst expectations, driven by demand for chipmaking equipment for AI infrastructure. The company projects 2026 revenue of €34 billion-€39 billion, surpassing previous forecasts. Barclays upgraded ASML to Overweight, increasing its price target to €1,500 from €1,200 due to strong demand and order intake, despite management's cautious guidance.

title: China Is The First Country To Ban Tesla-Style Door Handles Over Safety
text: China has become the first country to ban Tesla-style, electronically-actuated door handles on EVs due to safety concerns and related incidents. This move, taking effect in 2027, requires mechanical release mechanisms for car doors. The article also covers a significant drop in Tesla sales in Norway, an NHTSA investigation into Ford F-150 transmission issues, and Hyundai's decision not to reacquire its former Russian plant.

title: ETFs in Spotlight as Tesla Tops Q4 Earnings, Dips on Revenue Miss
text: Tesla reported mixed Q4 2025 results, beating earnings per share estimates but missing revenue expectations and seeing a 3.4% slip in share price after initial gains. The company plans significant capital expenditures, especially in AI and new product development like Cybercab and Optimus, aiming for future growth despite current challenges in the EV market. Several ETFs with high Tesla weightings are highlighted as potential investment avenues for risk-averse investors to gain exposure while diversifying.

title: Earnings call transcript: Aptiv’s Q4 2025 earnings beat forecasts, stock dips
text: Aptiv PLC reported strong Q4 2025 financial results, with EPS of $1.86 and revenue of $5.2 billion, both exceeding forecasts. Despite the earnings beat, the stock dipped 1.56% in pre-market trading, influenced by broader market trends and future guidance. The company anticipates moderate growth for 2026, driven by expansion in the EV sector and strategic partnerships in non-automotive markets, and is preparing for the spin-off of its Electrical Distribution Systems business as VersaGen.

title: Tesla's Q4 Earnings Call Gave Us An Insight Into Elon Musk's Optimus Ambitions, As Well As Challenges
text: During Tesla's Q4 earnings call, Elon Musk announced the discontinuation of Model S and Model X production at the Fremont factory to convert it into an Optimus robot facility, aiming for a million units annually. He highlighted the upcoming third-generation Optimus, emphasizing its general-purpose AI and ability to learn via observation. Challenges include a significant $20 billion CapEx, the need for advanced AI5 chips and "TerraFab" for compute, and growing competition from Chinese robotics companies.

title: McDonald’s discounts, meal bundles lift traffic, says BTIG as it upgrades stock
text: BTIG has upgraded McDonald's stock to Buy from Neutral, citing that the company's revamped value strategy, including increased discounts and meal bundles, is successfully driving consistent traffic growth. This strategy is expected to lead to a stronger sales and earnings recovery, despite a temporary setback in January due to severe winter weather. New product launches like the potential national rollout of CosMc’s beverage platform and the introduction of the "Big Arch" burger are also anticipated to fuel significant earnings growth.

title: Tesla Q4 Earnings: My CliffsNotes On 200+ P/E And Record CapEx (NASDAQ:TSLA)
text: Tesla's Q4 2025 earnings show a headline P/E ratio above 200x, but its owner’s earnings-based P/E is significantly lower due to strong underlying cash generation and aggressive growth CAPEX. The company's record $20B+ CAPEX for 2026 is viewed as a one-time, growth-oriented investment in AI, robotics, and new factories. Despite valuation concerns and uncertain returns on CAPEX, the long-term thesis is supported by TSLA’s secular and nonlinear growth potential.

title: IonQ Inc. (IONQ) CEO Says Stock Is Undervalued as Shares Drop 8%
text: IonQ Inc. (IONQ) CEO Niccolo de Masi believes the company's stock is "underpriced" despite its high multiple, arguing that markets often undervalue long-term winners early in their growth cycle. His remarks, disclosed in a Rule 425 filing related to ongoing acquisitions, portray confidence in IonQ's leading position in quantum computing compared to rivals. IONQ shares recently dropped nearly 8% to $39.98, yet analysts maintain a Strong Buy consensus rating with a target implying a 93.50% upside.

title: Ford, Xiaomi deny report of US EV joint venture talks
text: Ford and Chinese EV maker Xiaomi have denied a Financial Times report suggesting preliminary talks for a U.S.-based EV joint venture. Both companies issued immediate rejections to the claim. This development comes as Chinese EV manufacturers pursue expansion in North America despite existing high U.S. tariffs and political scrutiny, while Ford and other automakers are scaling back EV investments due to slowing demand.

title: Mediolanum International Funds Ltd Increases Position in PayPal Holdings, Inc. $PYPL
text: Mediolanum International Funds Ltd significantly increased its stake in PayPal Holdings, Inc. by 67.9% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to $10.33 million. Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions, with notable increases from Norges Bank, Lazard Asset Management LLC, and Arrowstreet Capital Limited Partnership. The article details recent analyst ratings, insider transactions, and provides a company profile for PayPal, highlighting its digital payments platforms and services.

title: Inside Tesla's $20B Capex Plan: How TSLA Is Shaping Its Future
text: Tesla plans to significantly increase its capital expenditures to over $20 billion in 2026, up from $8.5 billion in 2025 and $11.3 billion in 2024, to invest heavily in AI, robotics, and autonomy. This spending will fund six new facilities, expand existing factories, and build AI compute infrastructure to support initiatives like full self-driving, robotaxis, and the Optimus robot. With over $44 billion in cash, Tesla is positioning itself as a technology and AI-driven company, a strategy mirrored by other tech giants like Meta Platforms and Nebius, which are also ramping up AI-related capital investments.

title: Tesla Sales Slump to Three-Year Low in France, Plunge 88% in Norway
text: Tesla Inc. experienced a significant drop in European sales at the start of the new year, with registrations falling sharply in France and Norway. French sales decreased by 42% to a three-year low of 661 cars in January, according to the PFA. In Norway, where Tesla performed well last year, registrations plummeted by 88% during the same month.

title: Yeehaw: Trump’s Truth Social Funds to Acquire God Bless America ETF (YALL)
text: Trump Media’s Truth Social Funds, managed by Yorkville America Equities, plans to acquire the God Bless America ETF (YALL) from Curran Financial Partners, significantly expanding its assets and introducing its first actively managed fund. This acquisition, a rare move in the ETF industry, positions Truth.Fi to scale by integrating an existing fund that targets "God-fearing, flag-waving conservatives" and aligns with an "America First" investment philosophy. The deal highlights how politically aligned funds can attract interest and assets, despite some challenges in marketing morality in investing.

title: Elon Musk Fails to Deliver on His Cybercab and Optimus Promises—Again
text: Elon Musk has admitted that the early production of Tesla's Cybercab robotaxi and Optimus humanoid robot will be "agonizingly slow," despite previous ambitious promises for mass production and deployment. This admission contradicts his earlier targets for a 2026 Cybercab launch at an affordable price and Optimus robots working in Tesla factories by late 2025. Critics continue to highlight the significant gap between Tesla's self-driving technology and competitors like Waymo, with Tesla's Cybercabs still requiring supervision.

title: Inside ArcBest’s Next-Generation Logistics Technology Strategy with Dennis Anderson
text: Dennis Anderson, Chief Innovation Officer at ArcBest Corp., discusses the company's advanced logistics technology strategy. He highlights new platforms like ArcBest View and Vaux technology, the pervasive use of AI for optimization and efficiency, and efforts regarding electric vehicles. Anderson emphasizes the importance of responsible AI use, data quality, and empowering human teams with technology to solve complex problems in logistics.

title: US, European car brands have lost $114B on EVs — as idiocy abounds in electric market
text: US and European car brands have accumulated $114 billion in losses on electric vehicles (EVs) over the last few years, with legacy automakers losing $83.6 billion and pure-play EV makers Rivian and Lucid losing $30.2 billion. Major companies like GM and Ford have reported significant write-downs and job cuts related to their EV strategies, while several brands are shifting focus back to gas-powered vehicles due to tepid EV demand and financial setbacks. The article argues that EVs remain a niche product primarily for wealthy buyers, despite substantial investments and early optimistic projections from auto executives.

title: First Solar stock (FSLR) heads into Monday after Tesla’s 100‑GW solar talk jolts sentiment
text: First Solar (FSLR) stock is entering Monday with investor uncertainty after Tesla's announcement of plans for 100 gigawatts a year of solar cell production. While some analysts have downgraded First Solar due to concerns about pricing assumptions and increased competition, others dismiss Tesla's impact as overblown, citing the capital and time required for a U.S.-based solar supply chain. Investors are also anticipating First Solar's fourth-quarter and full-year results, and 2026 guidance, on February 24th.

title: Bye-bye corporate conglomerates. Hello personal conglomerates.
text: The article explores the rise of "personal conglomerates" like Elon Musk, drawing parallels to historical figures like Jack Welch of General Electric and Gilded Age robber barons. It details how Musk's diverse ventures, spanning Tesla, SpaceX, xAI, Neuralink, and The Boring Company, mirror the sprawling empires of past industrialists. The author discusses the potential implications of such concentrated wealth and power, including regulatory challenges and the financial concept of a "conglomerate discount."

title: Weekend Round-Up: GM Motors Earnings, Tesla Triumphs And Autonomous Vehicles Make Headlines
text: This automotive industry round-up highlights General Motors' strong Q4 earnings, surpassing analyst estimates, and Tesla's successful Q4 report which boosted its stock and revealed 1.1 million active FSD subscribers globally. Additionally, Pony AI expanded its Robotaxi operations through a new partnership, while Alphabet's Waymo experienced a Robotaxi crash during testing in Los Angeles.

title: Elon Musk is stressing robots over cars. Here are three humanoid parts suppliers that Morgan Stanley recommends
text: Elon Musk's increased focus on humanoid robots, marked by Tesla halting some car production to build Optimus robots, is fueling demand for specialized parts. Morgan Stanley identifies three Chinese suppliers—Leaderdrive, Inovance Technology, and Jiangsu Hengli Hydraulic—as key beneficiaries of this emerging market, expecting scalable production of components to precede widespread robot sales. The investment bank has doubled its forecast for China humanoid sales this year, signaling significant growth in the sector.

title: Narwhal Capital Management Sells 2,402 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
text: Narwhal Capital Management reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 0.9% during the third quarter, selling 2,402 shares and retaining 272,566 shares valued at $69.404 million, making Apple its fourth-largest holding. Despite this reduction by one firm, other institutional investors increased their positions in Apple. The article also touches on mixed analyst sentiment regarding Apple's recent performance, AI strategy, and supply chain issues.

title: Elon Musk Says 'Saving The State' As Delaware Supreme Court Slashes Tesla Legal Fees By Over $100 Million
text: The Delaware Supreme Court significantly reduced the legal fees Tesla Inc. owed in a shareholder lawsuit from $176.1 million to $70.9 million, citing an overvalued settlement by a Chancery Court judge. Elon Musk commented on the decision, stating the Supreme Court was "saving the state." This ruling involved Tesla directors agreeing to return $277 million in cash and stock options, though Musk himself was not part of this specific settlement.

title: Tesla: The Most Expensive Story Ever Told (NASDAQ:TSLA)
text: The article argues that Tesla (TSLA) stock is overvalued due to struggles in its core automotive business and reliance on declining regulatory credits. Intensifying competition, falling deliveries, and slow new model launches challenge its growth narrative. While energy and services show growth, they are too small to compensate for automotive declines, leading the author to reiterate a sell rating based on the stock's detachment from fundamentals.

title: Tesla already has a complete Robotaxi model, and it doesn’t depend on passenger count
text: Tesla has a comprehensive Robotaxi strategy that caters to various passenger counts by utilizing different vehicle types. The two-seater Cybercab will handle the majority of trips, while other Tesla models like the Model Y, Model Y L, and Robovan will serve larger groups. This approach mirrors current transportation methods, unifying diverse vehicles under a single autonomous software and fleet platform.

title: First Solar stock (FSLR) steadies after Tesla solar talk jolts sentiment — what to watch next
text: First Solar (FSLR) stock steadied after Tesla's solar manufacturing ambitions caused a previous dip, with analysts divided on the long-term impact. Mizuho and Wells Fargo view competitive worries as "overdone" due to the high costs and time required for new U.S. solar supply chains, while BMO Capital Markets downgraded the stock more cautiously. Investors are now looking forward to First Solar's Q4 and full-year 2025 results and 2026 outlook release on February 24th for further clarity.

title: STMicroelectronics stock price steadies after earnings whipsaw as analysts lift targets
text: STMicroelectronics' stock price steadied after a volatile week following its fourth-quarter earnings report, which indicated a net loss attributed to significant impairment and restructuring charges. Despite a projected decline in Q1 revenues, CEO Jean-Marc Chery expressed "better visibility" for 2026, leading analysts like UBS and Oddo BHF to raise their price targets. The company's performance is closely watched as an indicator for European auto and factory chip demand, with investors focused on the easing of inventory backlogs and the impact of its restructuring program.

title: Stellantis Mandates Five-Day Office Return as Auto Industry Reverses Remote Work Flexibility
text: Stellantis is requiring its U.S. white-collar workers to return to the office five days a week starting in 2026, marking a significant reversal of pandemic-era remote work policies. This decision aligns with a broader trend in the automotive industry, which seeks to boost coordination and innovation amid sales challenges and operational pressures. The move has implications for employee retention and competitive talent acquisition, especially in contrast to the tech sector's more varied approach to workplace flexibility.

title: Jim Cramer Says Tesla’s Robots and Robotaxi Progress Are the Real Drivers Behind the Stock’s After-Hours Move
text: Jim Cramer highlighted Tesla's surprisingly strong fourth-quarter financial results, including beats on top and bottom lines and $1.4 billion in free cash flow, as a key factor in its after-hours stock surge. He emphasized that the anticipation of Tesla's robot and robotaxi introductions is the "real driver" behind investors' enthusiasm, overshadowing past expectations that production and delivery results fell short. Cramer noted that for Tesla, particularly at this time, the specific numbers often matter less than future innovations.

title: PSLV price slides 27% as silver plunges — what to know about Sprott Physical Silver Trust before Monday
text: The Sprott Physical Silver Trust (PSLV) saw its shares plunge 27.2% after silver prices plummeted, triggered by a reversal in rate-cut expectations following news of Donald Trump's potential Federal Reserve pick and a hotter-than-expected Producer Price Index. Spot silver recorded its biggest daily drop since at least 1982, falling 27.66%. Investors are now watching for market stabilization and shifts in fund discounts as US markets reopen on Monday, with the January jobs report also on the horizon.

title: NIO stock price slips into weekend as China PMI turns down; Monday’s data in focus
text: NIO stock closed lower on Friday, mirroring declines in other U.S.-listed Chinese EV companies, despite Tesla's rise. This downturn occurred as China's official factory survey, the Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), fell below the 50-point mark, indicating a contraction in manufacturing activity. Investors are now looking to early February delivery updates and Monday's upcoming private-sector PMI data for further direction.

title: Direxion Daily TSLA Bull 2X Shares (NASDAQ:TSLL) Sees Significant Increase in Short Interest
text: Short interest in Direxion Daily TSLA Bull 2X Shares (TSLL) rose significantly in January, increasing by 54% to over 30 million shares, representing approximately 9.2% of its outstanding stock. Despite this surge, the short-interest ratio remains low at 0.4 days, indicating quick turnover. The article also notes modest institutional investments, that TSLL recently paid a quarterly dividend of $0.1122, and its current trading price, market cap, and P/E ratio.

title: Seabridge Gold Inc. (SA) Released a 2025 Year-End Report
text: Seabridge Gold Inc. (NYSE:SA) released its 2025 year-end report, detailing operational, exploration, and corporate initiatives completed by December 18, 2025. The company advanced power infrastructure and geotechnical drilling at KSM for a feasibility assessment and anticipates improvements in 2026. A B. Riley analyst boosted Seabridge Gold's price target from $50 to $65, maintaining a Buy rating amidst joint venture talks, KSM project advancements, and rising gold prices.

title: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods Lift Esquire Financial Holdings, Inc. (ESQ) Target After In-Line Core Performance
text: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods has raised its price target for Esquire Financial Holdings, Inc. (ESQ) to $85 from $80, maintaining a Market Perform rating, following the company's core net interest income aligning with expectations. Esquire Financial reported net interest income of $33.3 million, a net interest margin of 6.05%, and an increase in book value per share to $33.86. The company, a digital-first commercial bank, continues to focus on the legal industry and small businesses with tech-enabled financial solutions.

title: The Truth About Automatic Data Processing Inc: Why Wall Street Won’t Shut Up About ADP
text: Automatic Data Processing Inc (ADP) is a "boring" payroll giant that quietly processes paychecks for millions, generating substantial cash and attracting serious long-term investors. While it lacks the viral appeal of tech stocks on social media, ADP is highly regarded on Wall Street as a defensive play due to its stable, recurring revenue from essential HR and payroll services. The article explores why ADP is considered a reliable, dividend-friendly investment for those prioritizing consistency over rapid growth.

title: Investor Insights: Musk Mulls SpaceX/Tesla Merger and What to Expect From The Bank of England
text: This article discusses Elon Musk's recent activities, including reports of a successful Neuralink trial and a potential merger between SpaceX and Tesla, alongside Tesla's Q4 earnings. It also covers the Bank of England's upcoming monetary policy decision, with some analysts predicting four interest rate cuts in 2026, and highlights dividend-paying European stocks.

title: Fluence Energy CEO Pay Rise And Investor Moves Reframe Risk And Alignment
text: Fluence Energy's CEO, Julian Nebreda, received an estimated 4.36% compensation increase, bringing his total to about US$6.9 million, as disclosed in the company's latest filing. Concurrently, major institutional investors have actively adjusted their positions in the company, either adding or trimming their exposure. This convergence of CEO pay adjustments and shifts in large shareholder stakes provides insights into how leadership incentives and ownership alignment are evolving within the context of Fluence Energy's focus on grid-scale energy storage and its future growth prospects.

title: Robert Bender&Associates Cuts Nvidia Corporation Stake Sharply
text: Robert Bender&Associates, a hedge fund managed by Robert L. Bender, significantly reduced its stake in Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) by selling 19,751 shares. Despite this, TipRanks' AI Analyst "Spark" rates NVDA as "Outperform" due to strong financial performance and positive earnings sentiment. However, Spark notes potential bearish momentum from technical analysis and limited upside due to high valuation, though Nvidia's focus on AI and data centers positions it for long-term growth.

title: Analysts’ Opinions Are Mixed on These Consumer Cyclical Stocks: Birkenstock Holding plc (BIRK), Tesla (TSLA) and Amazon (AMZN)
text: This article summarizes analyst ratings for Birkenstock Holding plc (BIRK), Tesla (TSLA), and Amazon (AMZN), highlighting mixed sentiments in the Consumer Cyclical sector. Birkenstock received a Strong Buy consensus, Tesla a Hold, and Amazon a Strong Buy. The report details specific analyst price targets and success rates for each company.

title: Tesla persuades Delaware's top court to slash legal fees in director pay lawsuit
text: The Delaware Supreme Court has significantly reduced the legal fees Tesla must pay to shareholder lawyers in a successful lawsuit against the company's directors for overpaying themselves. The court slashed the fees by over $100 million, ordering Tesla to pay $70.9 million instead of the original $176.1 million awarded by a lower court. This decision was influenced by increasing criticism regarding legal fees in Delaware courts, with the Supreme Court stating that the original settlement value had been overstated.
